definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: He is, as it were , a walking dictionary.
Mr. Johnson was known as a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜先生被稱作一本活字典。

sentences.english: He is often lovingly termed a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 他常被親切地稱爲活字典。

sentences.english: She is, as it were, a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 她可以說是一部活字典。

sentences.english: For metal, it ranges from 6 pt, up to 72pt.
sentences.chinese: 在金屬活字方面，字大小的範圍從6點至72點。

sentences.english: The girl has an unusually large vocabulary and is known as a "walking dictionary".
sentences.chinese: 那女孩知道的詞真多，被稱爲“活字典”。

sentences.english: She knows so many words that she's a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 她知道這麼多單詞，是部活字典。

sentences.english: Movable type printing was invented in the eleventh century.
sentences.chinese: 畢昇於1041年發明活字印刷術。

sentences.english: The invention of movable type printing was also a major breakthrough in the Chinese book history.
sentences.chinese: 活字印刷術的發明是書籍史上的又一偉大變革。

sentences.english: He is what we call walking dictionary.
It can change the date if math with type printing board.
sentences.chinese: 如配上活字印板，可達每日變換日期的要求。

sentences.english: People in the Song Dynasty already used letterpress type to print.
sentences.chinese: 宋朝的人已經使用活字版印刷技術了。

sentences.english: Type metal: The alloy for cast type, comprising lead, tin and antimony.
sentences.chinese: 活字的合金，由鉛，錫和銻組成。

sentences.english: Why he was known as a walking dictionary it?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼他被稱作爲一本活字典呢？

definition: to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
color printing using several overlaid images
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
